definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Watermelons in Beijing in the summer are a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 北京的夏天，西瓜多得根本不值錢了。

sentences.english: I never said you were worthless. What I said was you’re not worth your weight in gold.
He found in India that subalterns were two a penny and invited nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 和少尉軍官多得不值錢，在哪兒也不會成爲座上客。

sentences.english: Youth is fortune. But, without struggle it is just unvalued.
sentences.chinese: 年輕是本錢，但不努力就不值錢。
就是所謂的“魔術說破不值錢”。

sentences.english: Why do you need such a small and unimportant flint?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼要這麼一小塊不值錢的火石呢？

sentences.english: Those online critics, they’re a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 那些網上所謂的批評家，不值錢到一毛錢就能買一打。

sentences.english: In flourishing city, the love of people becomes not costly it seems that.
sentences.chinese: 繁華都市中，人們的愛情似乎變得一點都不值錢了。

sentences.english: eg. Watermelons in Beijing in the summer are a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 北京的夏天，西瓜多得根本不值錢了。

sentences.english: I hold the opinion that the money we save now might be worthless in ten years time.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我們現在存的錢過了十年後或許就不值錢了。

sentences.english: A million dollars is a large sum of money.
sentences.chinese: 美金雖不值錢，壹佰萬還是個大數目。

sentences.english: They make up stories and cheat on people to buy their faked products which are with no worthy.
sentences.chinese: 他們會編造謊言，欺騙人們買那些不值錢的產品。

sentences.english: It was a cheap-looking Chinese cabinet, badly lacquered.
sentences.chinese: 那是個看起來不值錢的中式櫃子，油漆工藝糟糕。

sentences.english: There are some worthless articles of clothing in the old portmanteau.
sentences.chinese: 在那口舊皮箱裏，放着幾件不值錢的衣物。

sentences.english: In my view this painting is of no value.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這幅畫一點都不值錢。

sentences.english: Will be tattered weed, of small worth held.
sentences.chinese: 將成爲不值錢的衣衫殘舊。
